thread.title: Former HK chief executive Tsang found guilty of misconduct
thread.title_full: Former HK chief executive Tsang found guilty of misconduct

title: Former HK chief executive Tsang found guilty of misconduct
text:
Asia Pacific Former HK chief executive Tsang found guilty of misconduct Donald Tsang was charged with misconduct and bribery while he was Hong Kong's chief executive and is the highest-ranking official to be taken to court for accusations of graft. Posted 17 Feb 2017 20:36 Updated 17 Feb 2017 20:48 Former Hong Kong Chief Executive Donald Tsang arrives at the High Court to face trial on charges of misconduct in Hong Kong, China January 3, 2017. REUTERS/Bobby Yip A 
HONG KONG: Former Hong Kong chief executive Donald Tsang was on Friday (Feb 17) convicted on one count of misconduct. He was acquitted of one other, while the jury failed to reach a verdict on a third. 
Sentencing is expected to be carried out on Monday. Misconduct carries a maximum of seven years in prison. Sentencing on Monday. Misconduct carries maximum 7 yrs in prison. — Wei Du 杜唯 (@WeiDuCNA) February 17, 2017 After meeting with lawyers, Donald Tsang smiled and hugged his family. Now leaving court room holding his wife's hand. — Wei Du 杜唯 (@WeiDuCNA) February 17, 2017 
Donald Tsang was charged with misconduct and bribery while he was Hong Kong's chief executive and is the highest-ranking official to be taken to court for accusations of graft. 
More to follow.
